description:
This one was a hard nut to crack. I wanted to see the fainter spiral arms on the pic. Not so easy under my nightsky light pollution. But in the last weeks we had some very clear nights and I waited to capture the luminance images until this part reaches the most dark region in my sky in the northwest short before dawn. This I did over 4 nights. For color I used bin 2x2 which I exposed always before the luminance shots. Than of course a lot of processing work to get out the fainter parts. The CLS/CCD filter helps for contrast, but I think I am loosing so fainter stars with it. With the UV/IR filter the backround gets to bright. Red and  blue was quite ok but green is always difficult under my conditions. I think, I can not achieve more deepness with more integration time any more.....hope you like it like it is.
CS to you all

I put this image from the staging into the public area and can not set any technical data. Maybe a bug??
Edge 11 HD
ASI 6200 mm pro
Celestron reducer .7 for Edge 11 HD
ASI 120 mc for guiding
Williams Megrez 90 for guiding
Baader filters 2"
CLS / CCD Filter
L  95x300sec gain 300 bin 1
RGB all 30x350sec gain 350 bin2
title: NGC 3718
